name: tris(3-methoxyphenyl)phosphine
Reason: 3-methoxyphenyl groups, when connected to a phosphine base, significantly increase the melting point due to the enhancement of the crystalline structure and the increase in molecular weight. Each methoxy group introduces additional rigidity and hydrogen bonding potential, estimated at +5 °C for each methoxy group. The phosphine base itself contributes to the melting point due to its rigid structure and potential hydrogen bonding, estimated at +20 °C. The methoxy groups also increase the melting point due to the increase in molecular weight and the capacity for hydrogen bonding, estimated at +5 °C for each methoxy group.
